channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: Make March Purple
item.description:
Sunday, March 26, 2023

The Tropical Dome will be lit Purple to support Make March Purple.

Every 33 minutes a life is turned upside down by epilepsy Help turn things around - Make March Purple for epilepsy. Make March Purple is an Australia-wide campaign supported by epilepsy organisations across the country and the national peak body Epilepsy Australia. Purple Day, held on 26 March is an International Day of Awareness for people impacted by epilepsy. There are so many fun ways for Queenslanders to raise awareness and funds during March in support of people affected by epilepsy.

This Light Up is organised by: Epilepsy Queensland

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

item.title: Oceania Cycling Championships
item.description:
Monday, March 27, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Blue to celebrate Oceania Cycling Championships.

Brisbane, will again host the combined Oceania Cycling Championships as a part of the Brisbane Cycling Festival. The Oceania championship titles will be contested across the eight disciplines of BMX Racing, BMX Freestyle, Mountain Bike Cross Country, Mountain Bike Downhill, Para-cycling (Road and Track), Road (Time Trial & RoadRace) and Track. The Oceania Gran Fondo Challenge will also be contested as a non-championship event.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Endometriosis Awareness Month
item.description:
Wednesday, March 29, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Dark Blue to support Endometriosis Awareness Month. 

QENDO provides support, education and awareness for any one affected by endometriosis, adenomyosis, PCOS or infertility across Australia and New Zealand. We have the world’s only established 24/7 support line for endo, adeno, PCOS and infertilty. March is Endometriosis Awareness Month, we endeavour to make more people aware of this incurable disease. 

This Light Up is organised by: QENDO

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: Trans Day of Visiblity
item.description:
Friday, March 31, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit all colours to support Trans Day of Visiblity.

The 2023 Trans Day of Visibility Trans Day of Visibility (TDOV) is an annual international celebration of trans pride and awareness, that is dedicated to celebrating Transgender and Gender Diverse communities and raising awareness of the stigma and discrimination faced. In addition to this, the purpose of the day is also to celebrate our communities by being visible and proud.

This Light Up is organised by: Many Genders One Voice and Queensland AIDS Council

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Eve of 2023 World Autism Day
item.description:
Saturday, April 1, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Multi Colour to support Eve of 2023 World Autism Day.

World Autism Awareness Day (2 April 2023) raises awareness around autism and will help Autism Queensland continue to provide services to autistic individuals, their families and carers, and those who support them.

This Light Up is organised by: Autism Queensland

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Tour De Brisbane
item.description:
Sunday, April 2, 2023

The Tropical Dome will be lit Pink to support Tour De Brisbane.

Showcasing Brisbane as an international cycling destination, the Tour de Brisbane partnered with Splatt Lawyers welcomes everyone from elite riders, to weekend warriors, to families and kids. The event is headlined by the UCI Gran Fondo World Series, part of the internationally sanctioned series held all over the world.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

item.title: Autism Awareness Month
item.description:
Monday, April 3, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Multi Colour to support Autism Awareness Month.

Autism Awareness Month kicks off with World Autism Awareness Day (2 April 2023) and raises awareness around autism - a complex lifelong developmental disability that affects a person’s ability to communicate, interact with others and cope in everyday situations. The month long fundraising campaign helps Autism Queensland continue to provide services to autistic individuals, their families and carers, and those who support them.

This Light Up is organised by: Autism Queensland

item.title: 2023 Brisbane to Gladstone Yacht Race
item.description:
Wednesday, April 5, 2023

The Tropical Dome will be lit Blue and Yellow to support 2023 Brisbane to Gladstone Yacht Race.

In 2023, Queensland's iconic Brisbane to Gladstone Yacht Race will be celebrating its 75th edition. Steeped in tradition and stature, the 308 nautical mile Brisbane to Gladstone Yacht Race (affectionately known as the B2G) - which sets sail from Brisbane's Moreton Bay waters - is one of the oldest and most fiercely fought blue water yacht races on the Australian sailing calendar and one of the highest profile Easter sporting events.

This Light Up is organised by: Queensland Cruising Yacht Club

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

item.title: 2023 Australian Sikh Games
item.description:
Friday, April 7, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Orange to celebrate 2023 Australian Sikh Games.

The Australian Sikh Games are the premier sporting and cultural event for the Australian Sikh community. The Games are held every year in capital cities and major regional areas around Australia and coming to Brisbane in 2023. Over 4500 Athletes and 100,000 spectators from all over the country and overseas, including New Zealand, Malaysia, Singapore, Hong Kong, Canada and the U.K. come to participate in a wide array of traditional Indian and Australian sports and related events. The purpose of the event is to celebrate the cultural identity, preservation, building harmonious relations with other communities while celebrateing and engaging our large community and youth in sports. 

This Light Up is organised by: Australian National Sikhs Sports & Cultural Council QLD Inc.

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
item.x-trumba:customfield: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: 2023 FIFA World Cup Unity Pitch
item.description:
Monday, April 10, 2023

City Hall will be lit Rainbow to celebrate 2023 FIFA World Cup Unity Pitch.

FIFA Women's World Cup Unity Pitch installation and significant 100 days to go milestone for the 2023 FIFA WWC. - Largest global women's sporting event - Once-in-a-generation legacy for women’s sport in Queensland. - The Unity Pitch is to encourage the committee to engage with the FIFA WWC . The Unity Pitch will be open for use by local football groups and other members of the public, and will then be taken on tour to the nine host cities in the next 12 months. FIFA will also give a Unity Pitch to both Australia and New Zealand "as part of FIFA’s commitment to leaving a lasting legacy in each region.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: World Parkinson's Day
item.description:
Tuesday, April 11, 2023

The Tropical Dome will be lit Purple to support World Parkinson's Day.

Parkinson’s Queensland exists to improve the wellbeing of people impacted by Parkinson’s so they can live their best lives while managing a progressive and degenerative condition. Parkinson’s Queensland provides information, support, and education. Parkinson’s impacts over 18,500 Queenslanders, many who reside in Brisbane. Thousands more Queenslanders are impacted by Parkinson’s as carers, families, friends and colleagues.

World Parkinson’s Day is held every year on April 11, observed to raise awareness of Parkinson’s and educate people about the realities of this disease. Parkinson’s is the fastest growing neurological condition globally. The Day falls during the national Parkinson’s Awareness Month which raises awareness across Australia about Parkinson's. Sharing facts such as that over 130,000 Australians are diagnosed with Parkinson’s and over 700,000 Australians are impacted.

This Light Up is organised by: Parkinson's Queensland Inc

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

Parkinson’s Queensland provides information, support, and education. Parkinson’s impacts over 18,500 Queenslanders, many who reside in Brisbane. Thousands more Queenslanders are impacted by Parkinson’s as carers, families, friends and colleagues.
World Parkinson’s Day is held every year on April 11, observed to raise awareness of Parkinson’s and educate people about the realities of this disease. Parkinson’s is the fastest growing neurological condition globally. The Day falls during the national Parkinson’s Awareness Month which raises awareness across Australia about Parkinson's. Sharing facts such as that over 130,000 Australians are diagnosed with Parkinson’s and over 700,000 Australians are impacted.
This Light Up is organised by: Parkinson's Queensland Inc

item.title: 2023 FIFA World Cup Unity Pitch
item.description:
Wednesday, April 12, 2023

City Hall will be lit Rainbow to celebrate 2023 FIFA World Cup Unity Pitch.

FIFA Women's World Cup Unity Pitch installation and significant 100 days to go milestone for the 2023 FIFA WWC. - Largest global women's sporting event - Once-in-a-generation legacy for women’s sport in Queensland. - The Unity Pitch is to encourage the committee to engage with the FIFA WWC . The Unity Pitch will be open for use by local football groups and other members of the public, and will then be taken on tour to the nine host cities in the next 12 months. FIFA will also give a Unity Pitch to both Australia and New Zealand "as part of FIFA’s commitment to leaving a lasting legacy in each region.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: World Voice Day
item.description:
Sunday, April 16, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Red to support World Voice Day.

World Voice Day is traditionally celebrated on 16 April and was founded in Brazil back in 1999 with the aim of drawing attention to the science and phenomenon of voice production. It soon grew to highlight the significant role that the voice plays in every aspect of our daily lives. World Voice Day has gained momentum across the globe, and currently over 50 countries join the annual celebration during the month of April.

This Light Up is organised by: Australian Dysphonia Network Inc

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: World Haemophilia Day
item.description:
Monday, April 17, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Red to support World Haemophilia Day.

World Haemophilia Day is the 17th of April and raises awareness about bleeding disorders and the need to build a family of support for those living with this disorder. Families come in many forms but they all share the ability to support and advocate.

The Haemophilia Foundation Queensland (HFQ) provides representation, health promotion, education and support for people in Queensland affected by inherited bleeding disorders.

This Light Up is organised by: Haemophilia Foundation Queensland Inc.

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Anzac Day
item.description:
Tuesday, April 25, 2023

City Hall will be lit Red to commemorate Anzac Day.

As the sun rose on 25 April 1915, Australian and New Zealand soldiers rowed towards the shores of Gallipoli and into history. Every year since, Australians have gathered at Dawn Services or services of Remembrance, at parades, or in their driveways each year to remember their legacy and that of all who have followed in their footsteps. 

The first ANZAC Day Parade took place in Brisbane on the 25 April 1916, and this year, the 107th ANZAC Day Parade is an opportunity to celebrate and recognise all those that have served and still continue to serve our country.

The parade will be held on Adelaide Street, between George Street and Creek Street, from 9:45am to 12:30pm and will feature former and current ADF veterans and other groups that contribute to the Parade that make it the commemoration worthy of its heritage.

This Light Up is organised by: RSL South Eastern District

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

As the sun rose on 25 April 1915, Australian and New Zealand soldiers rowed towards the shores of Gallipoli and into history. Every year since, Australians have gathered at Dawn Services or services of Remembrance, at parades, or in their driveways each year to remember their legacy and that of all who have followed in their footsteps. 
The first ANZAC Day Parade took place in Brisbane on the 25 April 1916, and this year, the 107th ANZAC Day Parade is an opportunity to celebrate and recognise all those that have served and still continue to serve our country.
The parade will be held on Adelaide Street, between George Street and Creek Street, from 9:45am to 12:30pm and will feature former and current ADF veterans and other groups that contribute to the Parade that make it the commemoration worthy of its heritage.
This Light Up is organised by: RSL South Eastern District

item.title: 2023 Brisbane Comedy Festival
item.description:
Friday, April 28, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Red Blue and Yellow movement to celebrate 2023 Brisbane Comedy Festival.

Brisbane Powerhouse brings people together to create and experience adventurous arts. Our vision is clear: we act as a creative powerhouse for work authentically made in Brisbane, facilitating the collaborations and conversations between that work and the rest of the world. Brisbane Comedy Festival returns in 2023, bursting at the seams to host a hand-picked selection of the funniest folk in the country. Held from 28 April to 28 May 2023, this multi-venue laughter extravaganza held across Brisbane Powerhouse, The Tivoli and The Fortitude Music Hall, plays host to one-liners, whimsy and tall tales from some of the most hilarious comedians around. From stand-up to improv and sketch comedy, and everything in between.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Powerhouse

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: 2023 World Wish Day
item.description:
Saturday, April 29, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Blue to support 2023 World Wish Day.

April 29th is World Wish Day - a day that marks the very first wish granted by Make-A-Wish in 1980. This year, we're celebrating World Wish Day with a range of activities throughout the month of April. This includes a 'wear it blue to make wishes come true' - where people will dress in blue to show their support for Make-A-Wish. To celebrate World Wish Day and support our 'wear it blue' wish force.

This Light Up is organised by: Make-A-Wish Foundation Australia

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: 2023 Brisbane Comedy Festival
item.description:
Sunday, April 30, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Yellow to support 2023 Brisbane Comedy Festival.

Brisbane Powerhouse brings people together to create and experience adventurous arts. Our vision is clear: we act as a creative powerhouse for work authentically made in Brisbane, facilitating the collaborations and conversations between that work and the rest of the world. Brisbane Comedy Festival returns in 2023, bursting at the seams to host a hand-picked selection of the funniest folk in the country. Held from 28 April to 28 May 2023, this multi-venue laughter extravaganza held across Brisbane Powerhouse, The Tivoli and The Fortitude Music Hall, plays host to one-liners, whimsy and tall tales from some of the most hilarious comedians around. From stand-up to improv and sketch comedy, and everything in between.
